main_definition: An explanation offered in justification of a fault or minor offense, or as a reason to avoid an apology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A statement intended to justify one's behavior or actions.
meanings_and_examples.example: I didn't mean to be late; it was my excuse.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An apology for a minor mistake, flaw, or fault.
meanings_and_examples.example: Please accept my excuse for spilling the coffee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A reason given to justify one's behavior in response to an accusation or complaint.
meanings_and_examples.example: I can provide an excuse if you have any questions about why I was late.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something used as a pretext, often unflattering and intended to deflect blame.
meanings_and_examples.example: His excuse for not completing the project on time was that his dog had died.
